definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: The leader had joined the army much earlier after graduating from high school.
sentences.chinese: 这位班长自打高中毕业后就入伍了。

sentences.english: I been creeping all over, ever since I got here.
sentences.chinese: 自打来到这地方，我就浑身直起鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: I've known you since you were a young boy.
sentences.chinese: 自打你小时候我就认识了。

sentences.english: Since then, the repression of dissidents has been stepped up.
sentences.chinese: 自打那以后，持不同政见者遭到了镇压。

sentences.english: Ever since Besso has known him, Einstein has been self-sufficient.
sentences.chinese: 自打贝索认识他，爱因斯坦就是个自力自足的人。

sentences.english: I don't get down to Vermillion much since your mother died.
sentences.chinese: 自打你妈妈去世后我就没把维尔米林那边的事当回事。

sentences.english: Since the day that makes him contract, machine repair shop changed completely appearance.
sentences.chinese: 自打他承包之日起，机修车间就完全变了样。

definition: to be just about to/to have just started to
the first time/for the first time
lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
unprecedented/for the first time/never before/first ever
